Author: Paygine
Title: [ANN] Paygine ‚Äî open financial platform for business
Body: Dear subscribers!    We would like to finally break the important news about the expected PGC token exchange listing. We have received the reply from our legal team ‚Äì as you know, Paygine ICO has been approved by the SEC under Regulation D, which means we have certain requirements to comply with. This is relevant in particular to the rule 144 (available here https://www.sec.gov/reportspubs/investor-publications/investorpubsrule144htm.html)  Here is a quote from the document: ...Before you may sell any restricted securities in the marketplace, you must hold them for a certain period of time. If the company that issued the securities is a ‚Äúreporting company‚Äù in that it is subject to the reporting requirements of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, then you must hold the securities for at least six months. If the issuer of the securities is not subject to the reporting requirements, then you must hold the securities for at least one year. The relevant holding period begins when the securities were bought and fully paid for. The holding period only applies to restricted securities. Because securities acquired in the public market are not restricted, there is no holding period for an affiliate who purchases securities of the issuer in the marketplace. But the resale of an affiliate's shares as control securities is subject to the other conditions of the rule...  Thus at this point in time we have no other choice but to wait exactly one year from the moment our token sale was concluded which is 17 August 2018 before we can list our token on an exchange. However, we would like you to know that we are exploring ways of making listing as quick as possible. We will keep you updated on the latest news!

Title: [ANN] Paygine ‚Äî open financial platform for business
Body: Nowadays confidentiality has become a burning issue. The very idea of confidentiality these days seems closely related to cryptocurrencies, however, this is not entirely correct.  Confidentiality, in simple terms, can be divided into two things ‚Äì anonymity and untraceability. Anonymity means it is impossible to establish the user's identity while untraceability makes his actions impossible to be traced back to him.  When it comes to confidentiality in cryptocurrencies, most of them have the ability to provide anonymity, however easy it is to lose it. Untraceability, on the other hand, is not fully achieved as through analyzing transaction logs a researcher can identify certain users if anonymity of at least one of the involved addresses has been compromised. There is a number of methods used to achieve confidentiality in cryptocurrency space.  ¬∑       CoinJoin ‚Äì method of bundling transactions to obfuscate the source of the coins in transaction  ¬∑       Chaumian CoinJoin ‚Äì method of obfuscating the transaction log by using a central operator and blind signatures  ¬∑       CoinShuffle ‚Äì method of obfuscating transaction logs without a central operator using end-to-end encryption  ¬∑       Confidential Transactions ‚Äì method fully hiding the actual amounts, both incoming and outgoing, from third parties  ¬∑       Ring Confidential Transactions ‚Äì method utilizing ring signatures to obfuscate the source of the coins in transaction  ¬∑       Stealth Addresses ‚Äì method of calculating addresses to receive coins in a confidential manner  Every method listed above has its pros and cons that can only be truly evaluated in practice.

Title: [ANN] Paygine ‚Äî open financial platform for business
Body: Each partnership in business always has its own prerequisites and is individual, but the ideal partner program for any business should contribute to its development and complement its sales. Nowadays, many companies prefer to build relationships with each other on the basis of a relatively new model of cooperation ‚Äì White Label.  White Label is a very popular format of partnership in the world which opens new scenarios for business development. It is a type of cooperation between companies in which one company produces a product and the other sells it under its own brand. Due to this division of functions each of the partners can focus only on their competence ‚Äì production or sale, saving on product launch.  The world experience of using White Label model shows that such a way of cooperation opens up new opportunities not only for large companies but also for startups. Thanks to White Label startups are able to develop and implement products much faster. It is interesting that the sphere of business for the application of White Label model does not matter much, since this model has many ways of integration.  The platform Paygine based exactly on White Label model. We want to create a system that can help our customers to develop their business without entering into any competition with them! In this case we act only as a legal and financial "umbrella" for our clients, work exclusively in accordance with local and international legislation and comply with all relevant KYC and AML/Compliance procedures to ensure control of the operations carried out within the framework of the platform. Title: [ANN] Paygine ‚Äî open financial platform for business
Body: Nowadays, the pace of development of traditional financial service providers, banks in particular, is significantly behind the pace of development of modern technologies. Moreover, most of the major banks of the world still use in their practice the systems introduced in the 1960-1970s.
